title: Stable and fast Na-ion storage of recovered carbon from the spent carbon cathode of aluminum electrolysis
content:
Sustainable Energy Fuels, 2024, 8,1040-1047
DOI: 10.1039/D3SE01415K, Paper
Yao Lu, Zhifan Hua, Chao Chen, Zibo Chen, Xinyi Li, Hailin Yu, Ke Peng, Zhongliang Tian
The recovered carbon from aluminum electrolysis is used as the anode for Na-ion battery. It discharges specific capacity of 134 mA h g−1 at current density of 5000 mA g−1. It gives ∼100% capacity retention after cycled 2000 times under 1000 mA g−1.
